titleStmt.title: His Majesties message to the House of Commons From the court at York the 13 of August 1642.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most Excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill,

notesStmt.note: The King observing that the House of Commons is diverting £100,000, part of the sum raised for reducing the rebels in Ireland, contrary to the act, charges them to desist from this, as they will answer to God, the more so, as he does not wish any part of the £400,000 collected to be spent in making war on him. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
With engraving of royal seal at head of document.

person.persName: the Kings most Excellent Majestie: and
